intro: Tacsonia eriantha, commonly known as the velvetleaf or tropical velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia and Africa. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its broad, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming throughout the warm season. Tacsonia eriantha is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields due to its adaptability. It is also sometimes considered a weed in certain regions because of its rapid growth and ability to thrive in various soil types.
